00055 
00056 int FsPath::m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded=0;
00057 std::map<std::string,FsPath::FileFmt_t> FsPath::m_ext2fmt_map;
00058 
00059 //////////
00060 
00061 struct FsPath_Ext2fmt_t {
00062   const char* m_ext;
00063   FsPath::FileFmt_t m_fmt;
00064 };
00065 
00066 /// @todo add more file extensions here.
00067 FsPath_Ext2fmt_t initial_ext2fmt[]=
00068   {
00069     {"tsv",   FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00070     {"txt",   FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00071     {"bb",    FsPath::FILEFMT_TSVFILE },
00072     //
00073     {"a5",    FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00074     {"hdf5",  FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00075     {"ref",   FsPath::FILEFMT_FILE5 },
00076     //
00077     {"chp",   FsPath::FILEFMT_CALVIN },
00078     {"cychp", FsPath::FILEFMT_CALVIN },
00079     // end marker.
00080     {NULL,FsPath::FILEFMT_NONE}
00081   };
00082 
00083 void FsPath::addExt2Fmt(const std::string& ext,FsPath::FileFmt_t fmt)
00084 {
00085   m_ext2fmt_map[ext]=fmt;
00086 }
00087 
00088 /// @todo handle case (e.g. 'A5' && 'a5' are equivalent
00089 FsPath::FileFmt_t FsPath::ext2Fmt(const std::string& ext)
00090 {
00091   if (m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded==0) {
00092     FsPath_Ext2fmt_t* p=initial_ext2fmt;
00093     while (p->m_ext!=NULL) {
00094       addExt2Fmt(p->m_ext,p->m_fmt);
00095       p++;
00096     }
00097     m_ext2fmt_map_isloaded=1;
00098   }
00099 
00100   std::map<std::string,FsPath::FileFmt_t>::iterator i;
00101   i=m_ext2fmt_map.find(ext);
00102   if (i==m_ext2fmt_map.end()) {
00103     return FsPath::FILEFMT_NONE;
00104   }
00105   return i->second;
00106 }

00113 
00114 FsPath FsPath::getPathFor(const std::string& loc)
00115 {
00116   FsPath the_path;
00117 
00118   // @todo put windows code here.
00119   char* val=getenv(loc.c_str());
00120   if (val==NULL) {
00121     return the_path;
00122   }
00123   // these locations are always dirs.
00124   if ((loc=="HOME") ||
00125       (loc=="PWD") ||
00126       (loc=="TMP")) {
00127     the_path.setDirName(val);
00128   }
00129 
00130   else {
00131     the_path.setPath(val);
00132   }
00133   return the_path;
00134 }

00151 FsPath::FsPath(const std::string& dir,const std::string& name,const std::string& ext) {

00158 // In "harley-speak" init is a bigger "clear()"

00160   //
00161   m_err_doAbort=true;
00162   //
00163   clear();
00164 }

00167 void FsPath::clear() {
00168   m_original_path="";
00169   //
00170   m_dir_drive="";
00171   m_dir_name="";
00172   m_file_name="";
00173   m_file_ext="";
00174   m_filefmt=FsPath::FILEFMT_AUTO;
00175   //
00176   m_internal_group_name="";
00177   m_internal_table_name="";
00178 }

00181 #define FSPATH_DUMP_D(_x) { printf("   %-30s = '%d'\n",#_x,_x); }
00182 #define FSPATH_DUMP_S(_x) { printf("   %-30s = '%s'\n",#_x,_x.c_str()); }
00183 
00184 void FsPath::dump() {
00185   printf("== FsPath(%p):\n",this);
00186   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_original_path);
00187   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_dir_name);
00188   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_file_name);
00189   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_file_ext);
00190   FSPATH_DUMP_D(m_filefmt);
00191   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_internal_group_name);
00192   FSPATH_DUMP_S(m_internal_table_name);
00193   std::string str;
00194   str=asUnixPath();
00195   printf("   As asUnixPath(): '%s'\n",str.c_str());
00196   str=asString();
00197   printf("   As asString(): '%s'\n",str.c_str());
00198 }

00200 bool FsPath::empty() {
00201   if ((m_dir_name=="") &&
00202       (m_file_name=="") &&
00203       (m_file_ext=="") &&
00204       (m_internal_group_name=="") &&
00205       (m_internal_table_name=="")) {
00206     return true;
00207   }
00208   return false;
00209 }

00211 void FsPath::copyFrom(const FsPath& path) {
00212   // dont bother to do anything when self assigning.
00213   if (this==&path) {
00214     return;
00215   }
00216   // first opts...
00217 //  m_opt_pathsep=path.m_opt_pathsep;
00218 //  m_opt_internalsep=path.m_opt_internalsep;
00219 //  m_opt_extsep=path.m_opt_extsep;
00220   // ... then values
00221   // m_original_path=path.m_original_path;
00222   m_dir_drive=path.m_dir_drive;
00223   m_dir_name=path.m_dir_name;
00224   m_file_name=path.m_file_name;
00225   m_file_ext=path.m_file_ext;
00226   m_filefmt=path.m_filefmt;
00227   m_internal_group_name=path.m_internal_group_name;
00228   m_internal_table_name=path.m_internal_table_name;
00229 }
00230 
00231 void FsPath::copyDirNameFrom(const FsPath& path) {
00232   m_dir_name=path.m_dir_name;
00233 }
00234 
00235 void FsPath::copyFileNameFrom(const FsPath& path) {
00236   m_file_name=path.m_file_name;
00237   m_file_ext=path.m_file_ext;
00238   m_filefmt=path.m_filefmt;
00239 }

00241 #define FSPATH_NEQ(_slot) { if (_slot!=path._slot) { return false; } }
00242 bool FsPath::equals(const FsPath& path) {
00243   // FSPATH_NEQ(m_original_path) => for debugging - we dont care about its value.
00244   FSPATH_NEQ(m_dir_name);
00245   FSPATH_NEQ(m_file_name);
00246   FSPATH_NEQ(m_file_ext);
00247   FSPATH_NEQ(m_internal_group_name);
00248   FSPATH_NEQ(m_internal_table_name);
00249   //m_filefmt => derived dont test.
00250   //
00251   return true;
00252 }
00253 
00254 void FsPath::setDirDrive(const std::string& val) {
00255   // dont run unixify string; This should just be a letter and colon: "C:"
00256   m_dir_drive=val;
00257 };
00258 
00259 void FsPath::setDirName(const std::string& val) {
00260   std::string tmp=val;
00261 
00262   // convert it to our internal (unix) format.
00263   Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(tmp);
00264 
00265   // split off the drive
00266   if ((tmp.length() > 1) && tmp[1]==':') {
00267     m_dir_drive=tmp.substr(0,2);
00268     tmp.erase(0,2);
00269   }
00270 
00271   // assign with an optinal trailing slash
00272   m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(tmp);
00273 }

00278   m_err_doAbort=abortOnErr;

00281 AptErr_t FsPath::getErrNum() const {
00282   return m_err_num;

00284 
00285 AptErr_t FsPath::setErr(AptErr_t err_num,const std::string& err_msg)
00286 {
00287   m_err_num=err_num;
00288   m_err_msg=err_msg;
00289 
00290   if (m_err_num!=APT_OK) {
00291     // for debugging
00292     //printf("FsPath::setErr: err=%d msg='%s'\n",m_err_num,m_err_msg.c_str());
00293     //
00294     if (m_err_doAbort==true) {
00295       Err::errAbort(err_msg);
00296     }
00297   }
00298   return m_err_num;
00299 }

00305 AptErr_t FsPath::clearErr() {
00306   m_err_num=APT_OK;
00307   m_err_msg="";
00308   return m_err_num;

00315     return APT_OK;

00318 AptErr_t FsPath::setDirPath( const std::string & path ) {
00319   std::string temp1, temp2;
00320   return setPathHelper( path, temp1, temp2 );
00321 }
00322 
00323 AptErr_t FsPath::setPath(const std::string& dirname,
00324                          const std::string& file_name,
00325                          const std::string& file_ext)
00326 {
00327   m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(dirname);
00328   m_file_name=file_name;
00329   m_file_ext=file_ext;
00330   return APT_OK;
00331 }
00332 
00333 // See class docs for examples of valid paths.
00334 // No escaped backslashed characters allowed
00335 AptErr_t FsPath::setPath( const std::string & path ) {
00336   std::string tmp_os_path;
00337   std::string tmp_internal_path;
00338   std::string::size_type pos;
00339 
00340   AptErr_t aptErr = setPathHelper( path, tmp_os_path, tmp_internal_path );
00341 
00342   if ( aptErr != APT_OK ) {
00343     return aptErr;
00344   }
00345   
00346   //dump();
00347 
00348   // try at ".EXT"
00349   pos=m_file_name.rfind(FSPATH_EXTSEP);
00350   if (pos!=std::string::npos) {
00351     m_file_ext=m_file_name.substr(pos+1);
00352     m_file_name.erase(pos);
00353   }
00354 
00355   // ...and the internal name second.
00356   pos=tmp_internal_path.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00357   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00358     m_internal_table_name=tmp_internal_path;
00359   }
00360   else {
00361     m_internal_group_name=tmp_internal_path.substr(0,pos);
00362     m_internal_table_name=tmp_internal_path.substr(pos+1);
00363   }
00364   //
00365   //dump();
00366   //
00367   return APT_OK;
00368 
00369 }
00370 
00371 
00372 AptErr_t FsPath::setPathHelper(const std::string& path,
00373                                std::string & tmp_os_path ,
00374                                std::string & tmp_internal_path ) {
00375 
00376   std::string::size_type pos;
00377   clear();
00378 
00379   // save it off the original path
00380   m_original_path=path;
00381 
00382   if (path=="") {
00383     return APT_OK;
00384   }
00385 
00386   // tmp gets chopped up as we work and path is const, so we need a copy.
00387   tmp_os_path=path;
00388 
00389   // convert any MS-like paths to normal paths.
00390   Fs::unixifyPathInPlace(tmp_os_path);
00391 
00392   // if there is a drive letter, pull it off first
00393   // note this is ambiguous with a single letter file name with an internal 
00394   // group/table
00395   // "c:foo"
00396   if (tmp_os_path[1]==':') {
00397     m_dir_drive=tmp_os_path.substr(0,2);
00398     tmp_os_path.erase(0,2);
00399   }
00400   
00401   // The last ":" of the string seperates the internal name
00402   // ...../FILE.EXT:INTERNAL_GROUP/INTERNAL_TABLE.
00403   pos=tmp_os_path.rfind(FSPATH_INTERNAL_PATHSEP);
00404   // order is important, pull out the internal ":group/table" first.
00405   if (pos!=std::string::npos) {
00406     tmp_internal_path=tmp_os_path.substr(pos+1);
00407     tmp_os_path.erase(pos,tmp_os_path.size());
00408   }
00409 
00410   pos=tmp_os_path.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00411   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00412     m_dir_name="";
00413     m_file_name=tmp_os_path;
00414   }
00415   else {
00416     m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(tmp_os_path.substr(0,pos+1));
00417     if (pos<tmp_os_path.size()) {
00418       m_file_name=tmp_os_path.substr(pos+1);
00419     }
00420   }
00421 
00422   return APT_OK;
00423 }
00424

00427 std::string FsPath::getDirName() const {
00428   return m_dir_drive+Fs::trimTrailingSlash(m_dir_name); 
00429 };
00430 
00431 std::string FsPath::getDirNameSlash() const {
00432   return m_dir_drive+Fs::addTrailingSlash(m_dir_name); 
00433 };
00434 
00435 std::vector<std::string> FsPath::getDirNames() const {
00436   std::string drive;
00437   std::vector<std::string> parts;
00438   
00439   Fs::splitPath(m_dir_name,drive,parts);
00440   return parts;
00441 }

00445 FsPath::FileFmt_t FsPath::fmtFromExt() const {
00446   return ext2Fmt(m_file_ext);
00447 }
00448 
00449 FsPath::FileFmt_t FsPath::getFileFmt() const {
00450   if (m_filefmt==FsPath::FILEFMT_AUTO) {
00451     return fmtFromExt();
00452   }
00453   return m_filefmt;
00454 }
00455 
00456 std::string FsPath::getBaseName() const {
00457   std::string out;
00458   out=m_file_name;
00459 
00460   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00461     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00462   }
00463   return out;
00464 }
00465 
00466 std::string FsPath::asUnixPath() const {
00467   std::string out;
00468 
00469   out=m_dir_name;
00470 
00471   // add a sep if needed.
00472   if ((out.size()>0)&&(out.compare(out.size()-1,1,FSPATH_PATHSEP)!=0)) {
00473     out+=FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00474   }
00475 
00476   // now tack on the name if there.
00477   out+=m_file_name;
00478   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00479     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00480   }
00481 
00482   // add the "C:" if there
00483   if (m_dir_drive!="") {
00484     out=m_dir_drive+out;
00485   }
00486 
00487   //
00488   return out;
00489 }
00490 
00491 const char* FsPath::asUnixPathCstr() const {
00492   // put the string an a buffer.
00493   m_tmp_cstr=asUnixPath();
00494   // return the "char*" for the user.
00495   return m_tmp_cstr.c_str();
00496 }
00497 
00498 // read the following for why this is required:
00499 //   http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa365247(VS.85).aspx
00500 //   "Naming Files, Paths, and Namespaces"
00501 // In short: paths longer that 260 chars cant be processed, unless
00502 // (a) they are absolute
00503 // (b) they start with "\\?\".
00504 //
00505 
00506 std::string FsPath::asUncPath() const {
00507   std::string tmp=asUnixPath();
00508 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00509   Fs::convertToUncPathInPlace(tmp);
00510 #endif
00511   return tmp;
00512 }
00513 
00514 const char* FsPath::osUncPathCstr() const {
00515   // put the string an a buffer.
00516   m_tmp_cstr=asUncPath();
00517   // return the "char*" for the user.
00518   return m_tmp_cstr.c_str();
00519 }
00520 
00521 std::string FsPath::asString() const {
00522   std::string out;
00523 
00524   out=m_dir_drive+m_dir_name+m_file_name;
00525 
00526   //
00527   if (m_file_ext!="") {
00528     out+=FSPATH_EXTSEP+m_file_ext;
00529   }
00530   //
00531   if ((m_internal_group_name!="")||(m_internal_table_name!="")) {
00532     out+=FSPATH_INTERNAL_PATHSEP;
00533     if (m_internal_group_name!="") {
00534       out+=m_internal_group_name+FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00535     }
00536     if (m_internal_table_name!="") {
00537       out+=m_internal_table_name;
00538     }
00539   }
00540 
00541   //
00542   return out;
00543 }

00548 bool FsPath::isAbsolute() const {
00549   std::vector<std::string> dirs;
00550   std::string drive;
00551   Fs::splitPath(m_original_path, drive, dirs);
00552   if ((m_dir_name.find(FSPATH_PATHSEP)==0) || !drive.empty()) {
00553     return true;
00554   }
00555   
00556   return false;
00557 }
00558 
00559 bool FsPath::isFileName() const {
00560   if ((m_file_name!="") || (m_file_ext!="")) {
00561     return true;
00562   }
00563   return false;
00564 }
00565 
00566 bool FsPath::isDirName() const {
00567   if ((m_dir_name!="") && (m_file_name=="") && (m_file_ext=="")) {
00568     return true;
00569   }
00570   return false;
00571 }

00589 void FsPath::pushDir(const std::string& dir) {
00590   m_dir_name=Fs::addTrailingSlash(Fs::addTrailingSlash(m_dir_name)+dir);
00591 }
00592 
00593 bool FsPath::canPopDir() const {
00594   if ((m_dir_name==FSPATH_PATHSEP) || (m_dir_name==".") || (m_dir_name=="")) {
00595     return false;
00596   }
00597   return true;
00598 }
00599 
00600 std::string FsPath::popDir() {
00601   std::string popped;
00602   std::string::size_type pos;
00603 
00604   //dump();
00605   //printf("popDir('%s')==",osPathCstr());
00606 
00607   if (m_dir_name=="") {
00608     return "";
00609   }
00610   // cant pop an abs path.
00611   if (m_dir_name==FSPATH_PATHSEP) {
00612     return FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00613   }
00614 
00615   //
00616   m_dir_name=Fs::trimTrailingSlash(m_dir_name);
00617   pos=m_dir_name.rfind(FSPATH_PATHSEP);
00618 
00619   // no "/" found, the entire thing.
00620   if (pos==std::string::npos) {
00621     popped=m_dir_name;
00622     m_dir_name="";
00623   }
00624   else if (pos==0) {
00625     popped=m_dir_name.substr(pos+1);
00626     m_dir_name=FSPATH_PATHSEP;
00627   }
00628   else {
00629     popped=m_dir_name.substr(pos+1);
00630     m_dir_name.erase(pos,m_dir_name.size()-pos);
00631   }
00632 
00633   //printf("'%s'\n",popped.c_str());
00634   return popped;
00635 }

00639 bool FsPath::isReadable() const
00640 {
00641   return Fs::isReadable(asUnixPath());
00642 }
00643 
00644 bool FsPath::isWriteableDir() const
00645 {
00646   return Fs::isWriteableDir(asUnixPath());
00647 }
00648 bool FsPath::isWriteableDir(AptErr_t& rv) const
00649 {
00650   return Fs::isWriteableDir(asUnixPath());
00651 }
00652 
00653 AptErr_t FsPath::ensureWriteableDirPath()
00654 {
00655   // already writeable?
00656   if (isWriteableDir()) {
00657     return APT_OK;
00658   }
00659   // create the path.
00660   mkdirPath(false);
00661   // check that we can write to the last dir.
00662   if (isWriteableDir()==true) {
00663     return APT_OK;
00664   }
00665   return setErr(APT_ERR,"FsPath::ensureWriteableDir() failed.");
00666 }

00673 AptErr_t FsPath::chmod(int mode,bool errIfNotExists)
00674 {
00675   Fs::chmodBasic(asUnixPath(),mode, false);
00676   return setErrFromFs();
00677 }
00678 
00679 AptErr_t FsPath::mkdir(bool errIfExists)
00680 {
00681   if (dirExists()) {
00682     if (errIfExists) {
00683       setErr(APT_ERR, "FsPath::mkdir failed on path " + asString());
00684     }
00685     else {
00686       clearErr();
00687     }
00688     return getErrNum();
00689   }
00690   Fs::mkdir(asUnixPath(), false);
00691   return setErrFromFs();
00692 }
00693 
00694 AptErr_t FsPath::mkdirPath(bool errIfExists)
00695 {
00696   std::vector<std::string> dir_names=getDirNames();
00697   FsPath tmp_path;
00698   tmp_path.setDirDrive(this->getDirDrive()); // needed for win only
00699   tmp_path.setErrAbort(false);
00700 
00701   clearErr();
00702 
00703   for (unsigned int i=0;i<dir_names.size();i++) {
00704     tmp_path.pushDir(dir_names[i]);
00705     // only set errIfExists on last directory in path
00706     tmp_path.mkdir((i<dir_names.size()-1) ? false : errIfExists);
00707     if (tmp_path.m_err_num!=APT_OK) {
00708       setErr(tmp_path.m_err_num,tmp_path.m_err_msg);
00709       break;
00710     }
00711   }
00712 
00713   return getErrNum();
00714 }
00715 
00716 // There are two kinds of error here.
00717 // * If the file does not exist
00718 // * if the file exists after we attempt to remove it.
00719 // how should these to errors be handled/reported?
00720 
00721 AptErr_t FsPath::rm(bool errIfNotExists)
00722 {
00723   if ((errIfNotExists==true)&&(Fs::fileExists(asUnixPath())==false)) {
00724     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,asUnixPath());
00725   }
00726   Fs::rm(asUnixPath(),m_err_doAbort);
00727   //return setErrFromFs();
00728   return APT_OK;
00729 }
00730 
00731 AptErr_t FsPath::rmdir(bool errIfNotExists)
00732 {
00733   std::string tmp_path=asUnixPath();
00734 
00735   if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_path)==false) {
00736     if (errIfNotExists==true) {
00737       return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTEXISTS,tmp_path);
00738     }
00739     return clearErr();
00740   }
00741   //
00742   Fs::rmdir(tmp_path, false);
00743   //
00744   if (Fs::dirExists(tmp_path)) {
00745     return setErr(APT_ERR_NOTREMOVED,"didnt remove dir.");
00746   }
00747   return clearErr();
00748 }
00749 
00750 AptErr_t FsPath::rmdirPath(bool errIfNotExists)
00751 {
00752   FsPath tmp_path(*this);
00753   std::string dir_name;
00754 
00755   while (true) {
00756     if (!tmp_path.canPopDir()) {
00757       break;
00758     }
00759     AptErr_t rv=tmp_path.rmdir(errIfNotExists);
00760     if (rv!=APT_OK) {
00761       return rv;
00762     }
00763     tmp_path.popDir();
00764   }
00765   return clearErr();
00766 }

00771 AptErr_t FsPath::listDir(std::vector<std::string>& names) {
00772   return Fs::listDir(asUnixPath(),names,m_err_doAbort);
00773 }

00777 AptErr_t FsPath::touch()
00778 {
00779   Fs::touch(asUnixPath(),false);
00780   return setErrFromFs();
00781 }

00792 {
